docs.abstract: Renate Gotschl (Austria) wins World Cup downhill race at Lenzerheide, Switzerland (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: SKIING MANCUSO FALLS SHORT -- Julia Mancuso lost her nerve yesterday and with it valuable ground in her bid to become the first American woman to win the overall World Cup title in almost a quarter of a century. Mancuso finished fifth in the downhill in Lenzerheide, Switzerland, failing to reach the podium for only the second time in the last seven downhill races. The result dropped her further behind Marlies Schild in the race for the overall crown. She also trails two other Austrians, Renate Götschl and Nicole Hosp.
